I do continuous integration and I'm still using a monolith like sure it's building automatically but it's still a
big giant pile of stuff that I maybe don't understand all the pieces of um so
why not break that out and break it out into smaller Services plus the Ops benefit here is that I can scale those
Services separately so other than so I when I think about some of the kind of
the traditional monolith setups I feel like I guess maybe I'm cheap uh but it
feels like just like a lot of wasted resources so if I have everything in the same app if I want to scale that up I'm
scaling this huge giant app and maybe I don't need to so like maybe I just want
to scale up a messaging part of my app but I don't want to scale up my internal admin dashboard that almost never gets
any traffic you know what I mean so there's different pieces to that and I should be able to scale those pieces up
and down without worrying about the other pieces so that was the other big thing for me is that I could use only
the resources that I wanted to use and only the resources that I needed to use and account for the
traffic in very specific use cases so I could scale up individual pieces up and
down but I could also scale my cluster of containers up and down and those pieces were all separate so maybe I
needed to deploy the messaging app 16 times a week but I only needed to deploy
my admin dashboard twice a week um so being able to separate that out was made really intuitive for me with Docker but
yeah so you could just use continuous integration without Docker so Docker is not a magical solution to everything but
uh for me as a startup it solved a lot of the problems that were that were kind of pain points for me that it was it was
hard to figure out where exactly an issue was coming from it took a long time to deploy not everyone was even able to deploy um and then when
something went went wrong I'd have to roll the whole thing back and it end it meant that I ended up deploying less and
less and less often because everything felt so fragile um
